title: Rubio says South Africa’s ambassador to the US 'is no longer welcome' in the country
LIVE: Dangerous storms just a few hours from hitting the Wiregrass
US launches wave of air strikes on Yemen's Houthis
description: The US president cites the armed group's recent attacks in the Red Sea as justification.

title: Military planning for Ukraine peace to begin, says Starmer
description: Military chiefs will meet on Thursday to discuss practical plans to ensure Ukraine's security.

title: "Like Children Waiting To Know About Their Father": Nuns On Calls About Pope
description: How's Pope Francis doing? Can you give him my get-well wishes? Can I speak with him directly? The nuns who operate the Vatican's switchboard are fielding a growing number of calls with questions like that as the pope remains hospitalised in Rome.

title: Zelensky Presses Allies For Security Guarantees, Foreign Troops In Ukraine
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky said on Saturday he had urged Kyiv's Western allies to give "a clear position" on security guarantees including about a potential foreign troop contingent on Ukrainian soil with a US backstop.

title: Trump administration sends a clear message to the oil and gas industry: 'You're the customer'
description: The officials leading Trump's energy agenda downplayed climate change and called for more energy production to support economic growth and national security.

title: Trump says 'very good chance' of Ukraine ceasefire while Russia keeps caveats
description: Russia struck a sedate tone Friday but acknowledged grounds for cautious optimism, after only backing the "idea" of a U.S.-brokered 30-day ceasefire with firm caveats.

title: Haiti’s Biggest Hospital, Dependent on U.S.A.I.D., Is Set on Fire by Gangs
description: A fire set by gangs at the country’s largest public hospital underscores long-simmering problems in Haiti, which is heavily dependent on international aid.
author: David C. Adams and Frances Robles

title: Bread Lines and Salty Drinking Water: Israeli Aid Block Sets Gaza Back Again
description: Shipments surged into Gaza after Israel and Hamas reached a cease-fire, even if they weren’t enough. Then Israel blocked the border again to pressure Hamas in truce talks.
author: Vivian Yee, Bilal Shbair and Saher Alghorra

title: Markets digest bank earnings after recent turmoil
Still haven't filed your taxes? Here's what you need to know
description: So far this tax season, the IRS has received more than 90 million income tax returns for 2022.

title: Invocation of the Alien Enemies Act Regarding the Invasion of The United States by Tren De Aragua - The White House
description: Invocation of the Alien Enemies Act Regarding the Invasion of The United States by Tren De Aragua  The White HouseTrump invokes 18th century law to speed deportations, judge stalls it hours later  WBAL TV BaltimoreTrump invokes wartime Alien Enemies Act of 1798 to target violent illegal immigrant street gangs  Fox NewsTrump invokes sweeping wartime authority to target members of Venezuelan gang  CNNJudge blocks Trump from deporting noncitizens under Alien Enemies Act, orders flights turned around  ABC News

title: Severe weather sparks tornadoes and wind-fueled fires, with Southern U.S. on alert - NPR
description: Severe weather sparks tornadoes and wind-fueled fires, with Southern U.S. on alert  NPRLive updates: Violent tornado outbreak underway in South from storm that has killed at least 30  CNNAt least 27 dead as tornadoes ravage central US  YahooLive updates: Storms kill 28 and knock out power for hundreds of thousands  NBC NewsTornado Live Weather Tracker: Where Warnings and Watches Remain In Effect  Newsweek

title: Israeli strikes kill eight aid workers in Gaza, British charity says
description: The Al-Khair Foundation says staff were setting up a camp for displaced Gazans in Beit Lahia Saturday when back-to-back Israeli strikes hit their vehicles.
author: Sammy Westfall, Hajar Harb

title: Warning Iran, Trump orders large-scale strikes against Yemen’s Houthis
description: The president vowed to use “overwhelming lethal force” against the militant group for its attacks at sea and told Tehran to end its support or face consequences.
author: Alex Horton, Dan Lamothe, Missy Ryan, Mustafa Salim

title: Marco Rubio says South Africa’s ambassador to US is ‘no longer welcome’
description: US secretary of state accuses Ebrahim Rasool of being a ‘race-baiting politician who hates America’ and Donald TrumpThe US is expelling South Africa’s ambassador to Washington, with the secretary of state, Marco Rubio, accusing the envoy of hating the US and Donald Trump.“South Africa’s ambassador to the United States is no longer welcome in our great country,” Rubio posted on X on Friday. Continue reading...
author: Guardian staff and agencies

title: Sudan rejects US request to discuss taking in Palestinians under Trump’s Gaza plan
description: US and Israel reportedly contacted officials in Sudan, Somalia and Somaliland Sudanese officials say they have rejected a request from the US to discuss taking in Palestinians displaced from Gaza under Donald Trump’s plan to turn the territory into a “Riviera on the Mediterranean”.According to an Associated Press report, the US and Israel contacted officials in Sudan, Somalia and Somaliland about resettling uprooted Palestinians. The contacts suggested both countries are determined to press ahead with Trump’s proposal despite international outrage and massive practical difficulties – or at least use the plan to force other actors in the region to come up with their own ideas for Gaza when hostilities finally end. Continue reading...
author: Jason Burke in Jerusalem, and Mark Townsend
